meanings.definition: A person who is required to do something.
meanings.sent1: The obligers in the group always complete their tasks on time.
meanings.sent2: The obligers at work never miss a deadline.
meanings.sent3: The obligers decided to have a race to see who could finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: She was like an oblige, always fulfilling her duties without fail.
meanings.sent5: The obligers were like the gears in a clock, each one essential for everything to work smoothly.

meanings.definition: Those who feel compelled to meet expectations set by others.
meanings.sent1: As obligers, they always strive to live up to what is expected of them.
meanings.sent2: The obligers in the team never disappoint their coach.
meanings.sent3: The obligers joked that they were like superheroes with secret identities, always saving the day.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as an oblige, bound by invisible strings of duty.
meanings.sent5: The obligers were like magnets, drawn to fulfilling obligations wherever they went.
